intro: Xylopia fananehanensis, commonly known as the Fananehanensis xylopia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Cameroon and the Democratic Republic of the Congo. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered white flowers. Its fruit is a woody capsule that contains several seeds, and it is often found in moist forest habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
